title: 108_hr5226
content: SECTION 1. CROP DISASTER ASSISTANCE. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like "additional coverage," "insurable commodity," and "noninsurable commodity" related to agricultural insurance. Emergency financial assistance is also mentioned, overriding a specific section of the Federal Crop Insurance Act. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have suffered crop losses in 2003 or 2004 due to damaging weather conditions. This assistance will be administered similarly to the Agriculture Appropriations Act of 2001. The Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 allows for assistance to producers who experienced crop losses, with eligibility criteria including obtaining insurance for insurable commodities and filing paperwork for noninsurable commodities. The Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 provides assistance for crop losses by requiring producers to obtain insurance for insurable commodities and file paperwork for noninsurable commodities by the State filing deadline. The Secretary may waive requirements for producers on a farm if they enter into a contract agreeing to additional insurance coverage for insurable commodities or filing paperwork for noninsurable commodities. The Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 requires producers to obtain insurance for insurable commodities and file paperwork for noninsurable commodities by the State deadline. Violation of the contract requires producers to reimburse the Secretary for assistance received. Payment limitations restrict assistance to 95% of the crop's estimated value in the absence of losses. The payment limitations for crop assistance restrict the amount to 95% of the crop's estimated value in the absence of losses. This includes crop insurance payments and the value of any crop that was not lost. Assistance under this section is reduced by the amount received from other disaster programs. Assistance under this section is reduced by the amount received from other disaster programs, such as the Florida Disaster Programs. Livestock assistance program under SEC. 2. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide emergency financial assistance for livestock losses in designated counties for either 2003 or 2004. The funds will be administered similarly to the American Indian livestock program. The Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 (Public Law 106-387; 114 Stat. 1549A-51) states that in the livestock assistance program, producers will not be penalized for reducing their livestock numbers due to disaster conditions. The Tree Assistance Program is outlined in Section 3. The Secretary of Agriculture will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide emergency assistance to producers who suffered tree losses between December 1, 2003, and December 31, 2004. Additionally, $15,000,000 will be used to reimburse eligible forest landowners for tree losses under the tree assistance program. The Secretary of Agriculture will allocate $50,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation for the Emergency Conservation Program, providing assistance to participants with the maximum cost share percentage. The Commodity Credit Corporation will be utilized to implement this Act, and regulations will be established accordingly. The Secretary of Agriculture may issue regulations to implement the Act without following certain procedures, and congressional review will be conducted using specific authority. SEC. 7. OFFSET. Amends Section 1241(a)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 to allocate $6,037,000,000 for fiscal years 2005 through 2014.
